title: David De Gea's reaction to Newcastle defeat was 'a disgrace', claims Paul Ince
text:
Former Manchester United midfielder Paul Ince says the Red Devils are 'a complete mess' and branded David De Gea's post-match interview at Newcastle a 'disgrace'.

The 51-year-old, who played for United between 1989-95, was stunned by the Spaniard's comments after the embarrassing 1-0 defeat at St James' Park on Sunday.

'The Guvnor' told Paddy Power: 'I watched David De Gea's post-match interview and I was at a loss.

Paul Ince was flabbergasted by David De Gea's comments after Sunday's defeat at Newcastle

'He's meant to be one of the leaders, if that was Peter Schmeichel standing there, there's no chance you'd have seen that interview.

'This is one of the top players, the leaders at Man Utd, who has just signed a five-year contract.

'And he looks like he doesn't have a clue what's going on.

'If you're a United fan listening to your goalkeeper - one of the main leaders in the team - and that's the interview you hear, you'd be right to be disgraced.'

Defeat by Newcastle on Sunday saw Solskjaer’s side drop into the bottom half of the Premier League, just two points off the relegation zone after eight games.

Ince added: 'It seems to me that no one at the club has any idea what's going on.

'The club is a total mess. There are so many things that aren't right.

'There's absolutely no leadership from the very top of the club to the bottom.

Sunday's defeat meant Manchester United dropped into the bottom half of the Premier League

'It begs the question, what exactly are the team working on in training? What are they doing?

'I want Ole to do well, because I want the club to do well, but all he keeps saying is 'we're working hard', but what on?

'We've seen no improvements in the team. I want to know what exactly they're supposed to be working on, because I'm not seeing anything.
description: Former Manchester United midfielder Paul Ince says the Red Devils are 'a complete mess' and branded David De Gea's post-match interview at Newcastle a 'disgrace'.
